com.sri.ai.grinder.core.solver

Class AbstractBooleanWithPropagatedLiteralsRequiringPropagatedLiteralsAndCNFToBeSatisfiedStepSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.solver.AbstractExpressionWithPropagatedLiteralsStepSolver
      • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.solver.AbstractBooleanWithPropagatedLiteralsRequiringPropagatedLiteralsAndCNFToBeSatisfiedStepSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver, ExpressionStepSolver, LiteralSplitterStepSolver<Expression>, StepSolver<Expression>, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SatisfiabilityOfSingleVariableEqualityConstraintStepSolver, SatisfiabilityOfSingleVariablePropositionalConstraintStepSolver

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractBooleanWithPropagatedLiteralsRequiringPropagatedLiteralsAndCNFToBeSatisfiedStepSolver
extends AbstractExpressionWithPropagatedLiteralsStepSolver
    A specialization of AbstractExpressionWithPropagatedLiteralsStepSolver that returns solution false if propagated literals and propagated CNF are not satisfied by the context. This has been written with satisfiability in mind although it could apply to other problems.

    Like its super class, this class still requires extensions to provide propagated literals and propagated CNF.

    While it already provides the solution false for when propagated literals and propagated CNF are not satisfied by the context, it still requires extensions to provide a way to compute the solution for all remaining situations in which those literals and CNF are defined by the context (that is, when all propagated literals and propagated CNF are satisfied.

    Author:
    braz
